com.hazelcast.internal.networking

Interface IOThreadingModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NonBlockingIOThreadingModel, SpinningIOThreadingModel

    public interface IOThreadingModel
    An abstract of the threading model used by the Connection. The default implementation of this is the NonBlockingIOThreadingModel that relies on selectors. But also different implementations can be added like spinning, thread per connection etc. Apart from providing a hook to add new functionality, it also simplifies the Connection and ConnectionManager since concerns are separated: separated:
    1. the ConnectionManager is responsible for managing connections
    2. the IOThreadingModel is responsible for providing threads to the connections.
    The 2 crucial parts of the IOThreadingModel are the:
    1. SocketReader: responsible for reading data from the socket(channel)
    2. SocketWriter: responsible for writing data to the socket(channel)
    The TcpIpConnection is pretty dumb; it doesn't know anything about threading models; it just owns a SocketReader and SocketWriter. This keeps the TcpIpConnection very clean and flexible. The idea is that different SocketReader and SocketWriter implementations can be made. We already have specific one for non blocking (selector based) IO and for spinning io. These SocketReader/SocketWriter instances only focus on getting data to and from the socket; they do not concern themselves about interpreting the data. This is a concern of the ReadHandler and the WriteHandler instance each SocketReader/SocketWriter has. So a SocketReader/SocketWriter-class is independent of the type of communication that runs on top of it.
    See Also:
    NonBlockingIOThreadingModel, SpinningIOThreadingModel

    • Method Detail

      • isBlocking

        boolean isBlocking()
        Tells whether or not every I/O operation on SocketChannel should block until it completes.
        Returns:
        true if blocking, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        java.nio.channels.SelectableChannel#configureBlocking(boolean)}

        the created SocketWriter
